content: My understanding is that SUSHI only checks ~/.fhir/packages when trying to resolve package dependencies locally. Is there a reason that ~/node_modules isn't checked?

I'm not aware of anything that says that FHIR packages can (or should) be stored in a node_modules folder. Nothing in the NPM Package Specification doc or FHIR Package Cache doc says anything about supporting node_modules. But this kind of documentation is spread all over the place. Do you know of doc or spec that references node_modules or are you just assuming it should work like that because it uses NPM package format?

@Chris Moesel the latter. I'm attempting to use NPM to manage internal FHIR package dependencies. Just seems like it would be useful to only have to persist/look for packages in one location, instead of 2.
The rest of the tooling will use ~/.fhir/packages for caching the packages so changing it to another location would cause some problems of duplication, lack of synchronisation...
